benchmark_details.name: AutoBench-V (Automated Benchmark for Large Vision-Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: AutoBench-V is an automated framework designed to benchmark Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) across various evaluation capabilities. It generates relevant image samples and utilizes visual question-answering (VQA) tasks to facilitate efficient and flexible evaluations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a flexible and reliable automated evaluation framework for LVLMs, enhancing the efficiency and objectivity of performance assessments.

data.source: Generated through text-to-image models based on user-defined prompts.
data.annotation: AutoBench-V leverages visual question answering tasks to guide evaluations.

methodology.calculation: Calculated as the percentage of correctly answered questions in the VQA tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Performance metrics reflect the ability of LVLMs to correctly understand and respond to visual cues and questions.
methodology.baseline_results: Results showed varied performance across tasks, with declining accuracy as task difficulty increased.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted including ablation studies and evaluations against reference answers.
